div.p: Y71/95, unit 576, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Will you be so kind to inform me, dear Mr Odgers, whether I can send my return consignment for the La Plata Republic
direct
to Mr Verdon, for transmission, or whether the whole arrangement must be made through the C. S. Office. It seems to me to save much writing and trouble, if I could forward the case direct on board. It will be probably ready in time for the Kent.
With my best new years salutation

Ferd. von Mueller
On 5 January 1871 W. Odgers minuted: 'There is no objection to Dr von Mueller placing the case on board the Vessel but the Bill of Lading shd be sent to me for transmission. The rule that all correspondence for the Agent Gl. shall pass through this Office cannot be relaxed'.
T. Ware to M, 24 January 1872,requested the return of this letter. The form requesting return attached to this letter also requestedthe return of other early 1871 documents.
Attached with this letter, because it started with the above matter, is a form written by Thomas Ware, writing for the Under Secretary, dated 24 January 1872 asking M to return the following correspondence : 5 January 1871, 're plants for Agent General'; 1 March 1871, 're a case of seeds for Don José Martinez de Hoz — Buenos Ayres'; 14 February 1871 'recommends gratuity of £5 to Overseer Wilson of Industrial Schools'; 23 February 1871, 'recommends that Horticultural Improvement Society be allowed to hold a show in Botanical Gardens on 18th March'.
On 25 January 1872 M minuted: 'Request complied with | Ferd von Mueller' and the file was marked: 'Ret 26-1-72'.
should this go here or be relocated to 24/1/72?
RH: Probably relocate, but leave a footnote here recording the attachment to this letter of the form "… asking M to return this and other correspondence".
